trans-unit.source: Request increased DocumentDB account limits | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Request increased DocumentDB account limits | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to request an adjustment to DocumentDB limits such as the number of allowed collections, stored procedures and query clauses.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to request an adjustment to DocumentDB limits such as the number of allowed collections, stored procedures and query clauses.

trans-unit.source: Request increased DocumentDB account limits
trans-unit.target: Request increased DocumentDB account limits

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link> has a set of default limits and quota enforcements.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link> has a set of default limits and quota enforcements.

trans-unit.source: Several quotas can be adjusted by contacting Azure support.
trans-unit.target: Several quotas can be adjusted by contacting Azure support.

trans-unit.source: This article shows how to request an account limit increase.
trans-unit.target: This article shows how to request an account limit increase.

trans-unit.source: After reading this article, you'll be able to answer the following questions:
trans-unit.target: After reading this article, you'll be able to answer the following questions:

trans-unit.source: Which DocumentDB account quotas can be adjusted by contacting Azure support?
trans-unit.target: Which DocumentDB account quotas can be adjusted by contacting Azure support?

trans-unit.source: How can I request a DocumentDB account quota adjustment?
trans-unit.target: How can I request a DocumentDB account quota adjustment?

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Adjustable DocumentDB account quotas
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Adjustable DocumentDB account quotas

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the DocumentDB quotas that can be adjusted by contacting Azure support:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the DocumentDB quotas that can be adjusted by contacting Azure support:

trans-unit.source: Entity
trans-unit.target: Entity

trans-unit.source: Quota (Standard Offer)
trans-unit.target: Quota (Standard Offer)

trans-unit.source: Database Accounts
trans-unit.target: Database Accounts

trans-unit.source: Number of stored procedures, triggers and UDFs per collection
trans-unit.target: Number of stored procedures, triggers and UDFs per collection

trans-unit.source: 25 each
trans-unit.target: 25 each

trans-unit.source: Maximum collections per database account
trans-unit.target: Maximum collections per database account

trans-unit.source: Maximum document storage per database (100 collections)
trans-unit.target: Maximum document storage per database (100 collections)

trans-unit.source: 1 TB
trans-unit.target: 1 TB

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of UDFs per query
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of UDFs per query

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of JOINs per query
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of JOINs per query

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of AND clauses per query
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of AND clauses per query

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of OR clauses per query
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of OR clauses per query

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of values per IN expression
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of values per IN expression

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of collection creates per minute
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of collection creates per minute

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of scale operations per minute
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of scale operations per minute

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Request a quota adjustment
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Request a quota adjustment

trans-unit.source: The following steps show how to request a quota adjustment.
trans-unit.target: The following steps show how to request a quota adjustment.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Preview portal, click Browse, and then click Help + support.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Preview portal, click Browse, and then click Help + support.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of launching help and support</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of launching help and support</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Help + support blade, click Get Support.
trans-unit.target: In the Help + support blade, click Get Support.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of creating a support ticket</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of creating a support ticket</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New support request blade, click Request Type, and then in the Request type blade, click Quotas.
trans-unit.target: In the New support request blade, click Request Type, and then in the Request type blade, click Quotas.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket request type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket request type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Subscription blade, choose the subscription that hosts your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: In the Subscription blade, choose the subscription that hosts your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket subscription picker</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket subscription picker</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Resources blade, choose DocumentDB Accounts.
trans-unit.target: In the Resources blade, choose DocumentDB Accounts.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket resource picker</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket resource picker</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Support plan blade, choose Quotas Free Support.
trans-unit.target: In the Support plan blade, choose Quotas Free Support.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket support plan picker</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket support plan picker</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Problem blade, choose the problem category Quota or Core Increase Requests DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: In the Problem blade, choose the problem category Quota or Core Increase Requests DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket problem category picker</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket problem category picker</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Description blade, enter a description of the request.
trans-unit.target: In the Description blade, enter a description of the request.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to include the specific quota adjustments you are requesting as well as the account(s) to which the adjustments should be made.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to include the specific quota adjustments you are requesting as well as the account(s) to which the adjustments should be made.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket description textbox</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket description textbox</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket create button</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of support ticket create button</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the support ticket has been created, you should receive the support request number via email.
trans-unit.target: Once the support ticket has been created, you should receive the support request number via email.

trans-unit.source: You can also view the support request by clicking Support requests in the Help + Support blade.
trans-unit.target: You can also view the support request by clicking Support requests in the Help + Support blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screenshot of support requests blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screenshot of support requests blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> Next steps

trans-unit.source: To learn more about DocumentDB, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about DocumentDB, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
